title: Requires manufacturers to use a coding system on all handgun and assault weapon ammunition
summary: Establishes a statewide database to maintain and track coded ammunition; establishes penalties for individuals who violate such provisions; also establishes the ammunition coding system database fund.

       AN  ACT to amend the general business law and the penal law, in relation
         to establishing a statewide database to maintain and track coded ammu-
         nition and establishing penalties for  individuals  who  violate  such
         provisions;  and to amend the state finance law, in relation to estab-
         lishing the ammunition coding system database fund

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Legislative  findings.  The legislature hereby finds that
    2  each year in the United States more than thirty percent of all homicides
    3  involving a gun go unsolved. Handgun ammunition  accounts  for  approxi-
    4  mately  eighty  percent of all ammunition sold within the United States.
    5  Current technology for matching a bullet used in a crime to the gun that
    6  fired it has worked moderately well for years, but presupposes that  the
    7  weapon  was recovered by law enforcement. Ammunition coding is a new and
    8  effective way for law enforcement to quickly identify persons of  inter-
    9  est in gun crime investigations.
   10    S  2. The general business law is amended by adding a new section 396-
   11  gg to read as follows:
   12    S 396-GG. AMMUNITION CODING SYSTEM DATABASE. 1. THE DIVISION OF CRIMI-
   13  NAL JUSTICE SERVICES IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING  AN
   14  AMMUNITION  CODING  SYSTEM  DATABASE  CONTAINING  INFORMATION  FROM  THE
   15  FOLLOWING:
   16    A. THE MANUFACTURER REGISTRY. (I) EVERY  MANUFACTURER  SHALL  REGISTER
   17  WITH THE DIVISION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE SERVICES IN A MANNER PRESCRIBED BY
   18  THE  DIVISION, AND SHALL MAINTAIN RECORDS ON THE BUSINESS PREMISES FOR A

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03639-01-1

       A. 1150                             2

    1  PERIOD OF SEVEN YEARS CONCERNING ALL  SALES,  LOANS,  AND  TRANSFERS  OF
    2  AMMUNITION TO, FROM, OR WITHIN THE STATE.
    3    (II)  EVERY  MANUFACTURER  SHALL  CODE ANY AMMUNITION FOR HANDGUNS AND
    4  ASSAULT WEAPONS SOLD OR MANUFACTURED AFTER JANUARY FIRST,  TWO  THOUSAND
    5  TWELVE.
    6    B. THE VENDOR REGISTRY. EVERY VENDOR OF AMMUNITION SHALL REGISTER WITH
    7  THE  DIVISION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE SERVICES IN A MANNER PRESCRIBED BY THE
    8  DIVISION, AND  SHALL  RECORD  THE  FOLLOWING  INFORMATION  IN  A  FORMAT
    9  PRESCRIBED BY THE DIVISION:
   10    (I) THE DATE OF THE TRANSACTION;
   11    (II) THE NAME OF THE TRANSFEREE;
   12    (III)  THE  PURCHASER'S  DRIVER'S  LICENSE  NUMBER OR OTHER GOVERNMENT
   13  ISSUED IDENTIFICATION CARD NUMBER;
   14    (IV) THE DATE OF BIRTH OF THE PURCHASER;
   15    (V) THE UNIQUE IDENTIFIER OF ALL HANDGUN AMMUNITION OR BULLETS  TRANS-
   16  FERRED; AND
   17    (VI) ANY OTHER INFORMATION DETERMINED NECESSARY BY THE DIVISION.
   18    EVERY  VENDOR  SHALL  MAINTAIN  THESE  RECORDS ON THEIR PREMISES FOR A
   19  PERIOD OF AT LEAST THREE YEARS FROM THE DATE OF THE RECORDED PURCHASE.
   20    2. TO THE GREATEST EXTENT POSSIBLE OR PRACTICAL, THE AMMUNITION CODING
   21  SYSTEM DATABASE SHALL BE BUILT WITHIN THE FRAMEWORK OF EXISTING FIREARMS
   22  DATABASES. THE AMMUNITION CODING SYSTEM DATABASE SHALL BE OPERATIONAL NO
   23  LATER THAN JANUARY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND THIRTEEN.
   24    3. PRIVACY OF INDIVIDUALS IS  OF  THE  UTMOST  IMPORTANCE.  ACCESS  TO
   25  INFORMATION IN THE AMMUNITION CODING SYSTEM DATABASE IS RESERVED FOR KEY
   26  LAW  ENFORCEMENT  PERSONNEL AND TO BE RELEASED ONLY IN CONNECTION WITH A
   27  CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION.
   28    4. THE COST OF MAINTAINING THE DATABASE SHALL BE FUNDED BY THE AMMUNI-
   29  TION CODING SYSTEM DATABASE FUND ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO  SECTION  NINE-
   30  TY-ONE-H  OF  THE  STATE FINANCE LAW. VENDORS SHALL CHARGE AN ADDITIONAL
   31  $.005 PER BULLET OR ROUND OF AMMUNITION TO THE PURCHASER.   SUCH  MONEYS
   32  SHALL BE DEPOSITED INTO THE FUND.
   33    5.  ANY  PERSON  IN POSSESSION OF NON-CODED AMMUNITION MUST DISPOSE OF
   34  SUCH AMMUNITION NO LATER THAN JANUARY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND FOURTEEN.
   35    6. A. ANY  MANUFACTURER  THAT  WILLFULLY  FAILS  TO  COMPLY  WITH  THE
   36  PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE SUBJECT TO A FINE OF UP TO ONE THOU-
   37  SAND  DOLLARS FOR A FIRST OFFENSE; A FINE OF UP TO FIVE THOUSAND DOLLARS
   38  FOR A SECOND OFFENSE; AND A FINE OF UP TO TEN  THOUSAND  DOLLARS  FOR  A
   39  THIRD AND EACH SUBSEQUENT OFFENSE.
   40    B.  ANY  VENDOR  THAT WILLFULLY FAILS TO COMPLY WITH THE PROVISIONS OF
   41  THIS SECTION SHALL BE SUBJECT TO A FINE OF UP TO  ONE  THOUSAND  DOLLARS
   42  FOR  A  FIRST OFFENSE; A FINE OF UP TO TWO THOUSAND DOLLARS FOR A SECOND
   43  OFFENSE; AND A FINE OF UP TO FIVE THOUSAND DOLLARS FOR A THIRD AND  EACH
   44  SUBSEQUENT  OFFENSE.  IN  ADDITION  TO ANY FINE IMPOSED PURSUANT TO THIS
   45  SECTION, A VENDOR MAY BE SUBJECT TO A TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF LESS  THAN
   46  ONE YEAR FOR EACH VIOLATION.
   47    7.  FOR  PURPOSES  OF  THIS SECTION, "CODED AMMUNITION" MEANS A BULLET
   48  CARRYING A UNIQUE IDENTIFIER THAT HAS BEEN APPLIED BY ETCHING  ONTO  THE
   49  BASE OF THE BULLET PROJECTILE.
   50    S  3.  The penal law is amended by adding a new section 265.45 to read
   51  as follows:
   52  S 265.45 UNLAWFUL SALE OR POSSESSION OF UNCODED AMMUNITION.
   53    A PERSON IS GUILTY OF UNLAWFUL SALE OF UNCODED AMMUNITION WHEN  HE  OR
   54  SHE:
   55    1.  SELLS  ANY  AMMUNITION THAT HAS NOT BEEN CODED PURSUANT TO SECTION
   56  THREE HUNDRED NINETY-SIX-GG OF THE GENERAL BUSINESS LAW; OR

       A. 1150                             3

    1    2. POSSESSES ANY AMMUNITION THAT IS UNCODED, OR THE CODE OF WHICH  HAS
    2  BEEN RENDERED UNREADABLE.
    3    UNLAWFUL  SALE OR POSSESSION OF UNCODED AMMUNITION IS A CLASS A MISDE-
    4  MEANOR.
    5    S 4. The state finance law is amended by adding a new section 91-h  to
    6  read as follows:
    7    S  91-H.  AMMUNITION  CODING  SYSTEM DATABASE FUND. 1. THERE IS HEREBY
    8  CREATED IN THE JOINT CUSTODY OF THE COMPTROLLER AND THE COMMISSIONER  OF
    9  TAXATION AND FINANCE, A FUND TO BE KNOWN AS THE AMMUNITION CODING SYSTEM
   10  DATABASE FUND.
   11    2.  THE FUND SHALL CONSIST OF ALL MONEYS COLLECTED PURSUANT TO SECTION
   12  THREE HUNDRED NINETY-SIX-GG OF THE GENERAL BUSINESS LAW,  OR  ANY  OTHER
   13  MONEY APPROPRIATED TO THE FUND BY LAW.
   14    3.  THE MONEYS OF THE FUND SHALL BE USED TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN THE
   15  AMMUNITION CODING SYSTEM DATABASE  CREATED  PURSUANT  TO  SECTION  THREE
   16  HUNDRED NINETY-SIX-GG OF THE GENERAL BUSINESS LAW.
   17    4.  MONEYS  SHALL BE PAYABLE FROM THE FUND ON THE AUDIT AND WARRANT OF
   18  THE STATE COMPTROLLER ON VOUCHERS APPROVED AND CERTIFIED BY THE DIRECTOR
   19  OF THE DIVISION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE SERVICES.
   20    S 5. This act shall take effect on the ninetieth day  after  it  shall
   21  have become a law.
